intro: Micromeria canariensis, commonly known as the Canary Islands micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish or greenish flowers that bloom in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
